TopicTitle: The Onion hits it out of the park again

Articles.Content:
http://www.theonion.com/articles/modernized-space-camp-allows-kids-to-simulate-frus,36148/

I just have no words
Hypothetical scenario.. NASA's budget percentage remained the same since Apollo. Where would we be?

Like it or not, it isn't really budget problems that Nasa has...its a bureacracy problem. Basically NASA's supply line and facilities are divided up amongst states as part of pork projects, so it is inherently designed to spend the money it is allocated as inefficiently as possible. Thats why Space X is able to design the Falcon heavy for about 450 million, and NASA has to spend 20 billion to fund the SLS, which is only marginally better-and several years behind in development.

Even in inflation adjusted dollars the Atlas V only cost 1.9 billion. So money isn't really the issue...its congress laying stupid pork projects and absurd requirements onto NASA to satisfy their constituents.
